ACCUEIL.TITRE: Welcome to the Precision Shooting Competition site
ACCUEIL.INTRO: This platform allows you to view monthly results, competition rules, and useful information for participating shooters.
ACCUEIL.NOTE: * Please check the club calendar for the exact schedule.

TIRAGE.INTRO.4: , ensuring a fair chance for all participants.
TIRAGE.CONCLUSION: These bonuses reward performance while encouraging active participation. Ranking becomes a strategic way to increase your chances of winning the monthly draw.

DEROULEMENT.TITLE: Competition Process
DEROULEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Describe how the competition is conducted (e.g., number of shots, duration, etc.).

CATEGORIES.INTRO: The definition of official categories is being finalized. This classification aims to fairly organize shooter participation based on various criteria, such as:
CATEGORIES.TYPE_ARME: Type of rifle (air rifle, .22 LR, centerfire, etc.)
CATEGORIES.CLASSE_AGE: Classification or age (if applicable according to current regulations)
CATEGORIES.NOTE: Official categories will be published shortly after validation by the organizing bodies.

FEUILLE.INTRO1: The scoring sheet is an official document used to record individual results for each shooter during a competition.
FEUILLE.INTRO2: It must be signed by the official at the end of the session.
FEUILLE.ELEMENTS_TITRE: Elements contained in the participation sheet
FEUILLE.ELEMENT11: Club stamp with the signature of the responsible shooting official
FEUILLE.PRESENTATION_TEXTE: The target presentation is standardized for all participants, whether seated, standing, or supported on a shooting bench. All targets, whether in the training area (numbered P1 to P5) or the scored section (numbered 1 to 20), follow the same layout and visibility criteria.
FEUILLE.DIMENSIONS_TITRE: Dimensions of Regular and Elite Targets
FEUILLE.DIMENSIONS_INTRO: Provides the dimension of each scoring ring and the point size for the bonus.
FEUILLE.ROW1: Center point for a perfect shot
FEUILLE.EPREUVE2: Shooting position: supported on a shooting table
FEUILLE.EPREUVE6: Number of shoots per sheet: unlimited*
FEUILLE.NOTE: See the Scoring System section for qualifying shots.

CALCULPOINTS.TITLE: Scoring System
CALCULPOINTS.DESCRIPTION: Describe the point calculation rules for each target, including penalties, bonuses, etc.

TIRPARFAIT.TITLE: Perfect Shot
TIRPARFAIT.DESCRIPTION: The shooter hits the center of the target flawlessly, completely removing the central dot. They receive 10 base points plus 1 bonus point.

TIRSOLIDE.TITLE: Excellent Shot without Bonus
TIRSOLIDE.DESCRIPTION: The shooter hits the center of the target with no error, but does not completely remove the central dot. They receive 10 base points.

TIRINVALIDE.TITLE: Invalid Shot
TIRINVALIDE.DESCRIPTION: The shot contains an error: either a double shot on the same target or a shot outside the target area (within the frame but outside the scoring zone). No points are awarded.

TIRTRICHE.TITLE: Attempt to Cheat
TIRTRICHE.DESCRIPTION: The target has been altered, replaced, or manipulated to artificially increase the score. ==> Automatic disqualification <==.

CLASSEMENT.INTRO1: Shooters are ranked based on their performance in scored events.

DIAMANT.ALERT: This category is currently under development and is not yet officially active. No trials are scheduled at this time. Its future implementation will be determined by the organizing committee based on evolving needs and competition goals.
DIAMANT.CONDITION4: If the base score is not reached, no ranking is assigned

NOTE.TEXTE5: will not be ranked in any group, even with an excellent bonus score.
